business.headline: Sensex, Nifty rebound: What's driving today's gains, and will the recovery last?Despite today's rally, the stock market remains under pressure due to several factors, especially the impact of Q3 earnings and sustained selling by foreign institutional investors.

Quadrant Future Tek listing: Shares make strong D-Street debut at 27% premium Quadrant Future Tek stock: The stock opened at Rs 370 on the NSE, reflecting a 27.5% premium over its IPO price of Rs 290.
Stock market rebound: Sensex, Nifty gain in early trade; HCLTech down 9% The S&P BSE Sensex gained 408.52 points to 76,738.53, while the NSE Nifty50 110.05 points to 23,196.00 as of 9:30 AM.

TikTok US may go to Elon Musk as China explores potential sale: ReportChinese authorities want to keep TikTok under the control of its parent company, ByteDance. One potential scenario involves Elon Musk's social media platform, X, acquiring TikTok US and running it jointly with ByteDance.

Stock market holiday: Are BSE, NSE open on January 14, Makar Sankranti?The holiday schedules for the BSE and NSE are determined based on national holidays and key religious and cultural festivals that are widely observed across the country.
Red alert on Dalal Street: Should investors worry?Sensex, Nifty today: While the sharp decline may cause concern, historical data suggests that market corrections are not uncommon.
Stocks to watch today: JSW Cements, HDFC AMC, HCLTech, BEL, Adani WilmarStocks such as JSW Cements, HDFC AMC, HCLTech, Delta Corp, United Spirits, and BEL are expected to remain in focus.
Retail inflation eases to 4-month low of 5.22% in DecemberIndia's inflation eased to 5.22% in December 2024 as food prices slowed, with the RBI maintaining a cautious policy stance.
Budget 2025: 5 important things government needs to addressGoldman Sachs outlines five key questions on fiscal deficit, spending, and growth ahead of Budget 2025.

Market crash wipes out Rs 13 lakh crore. Will D-Street's losing streak continue? Stock Market Crash: Dalal Street faced another sharp decline on Monday, with key indices tumbling and investors suffering heavy losses. Is this a temporary dip, or the start of a prolonged bear run?

Activate your UAN for EPFO's ELI scheme benefits before January 15. Here's howThe deadline for UAN activation has been extended to January 15, 2025, urging employees to complete the process to avail ELI scheme benefits.
Monday mayhem on Dalal Street as Sensex tanks 1,100 pointsThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1048.90 points to end at 76,330.01, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 345.55 points to close the day at 23,085.95.
NPCI issues clarification on 'Jumped Deposit Scam.' 3 key things to knowNPCI debunks 'Jumped Deposit Scam' fears, urging UPI users to stay alert and trust in the platform's robust security.

Sensex nosedives over 1,100 points. Why did stock market crash today?Stock market crash: The Sensex was down 1041.18 points to 76,337.73 at 2:50 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 329.70 points lower at 23,101.80. All the other broader market indices were trading in negative territory as volatility skyrocketed during the afternoon trading session.

Want to get your credit card's annual fee waived? Follow these stepsMany banks offer ways to waive credit card annual fees by meeting specific spending thresholds, allowing you to enjoy benefits without extra costs.

Trading platform Groww plans IPO at $6-8 billion valuation: ReportIf successful, Groww's listing will mark the first IPO by a digital trading platform in India, adding a new chapter to the rapidly expanding fintech landscape.

Laxmi Dental IPO: Should you bid for the Rs 698.06 crore public listing? Laxmi Dental IPO will remain open for subscription until January 15, 2024 with allotment for shares expected to be completed on January 16, 2025.

Boss bought Lamborghini, thanked our 90-hour workweek: Investor adds to L&T memesL&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan recently sparked controversy with his proposal of a 90-hour workweek and working on Sundays.

HCLTech share price flat ahead of Q3 earnings. What to expect?HCLTech share price and Q3 results: The IT giant is set to report its quarterly results with expectations of a modest rise in profit and revenue despite challenges in key business segments.

HCLTech to announce Q3 results today: What to expect from the IT giant HCLTech Q3 results preview: Market analysts predict that HCLTech will show robust growth in the December quarter, driven by its software business and recent acquisition of the Communications Technology Group (CTG).

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Freebies to continue, 'Kejriwal's Guarantee' to have 7–8 promises: SourcesThe AAP's manifesto will be called 'Kejriwal's Guarantee', on the lines of the 'Modi ki Guarantee' slogan that was launched by the BJP ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha election.

No WAGs, family on tour: BCCI disciplines India after Australia seriesThe Indian Cricket Board has reacted sharply to India's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Sources have told India Today that the BCCI has cracked the whip on the Indian team and has taken strict steps to get their focus back on the game.

Case against Atishi for violating code of conduct ahead of Delhi pollsThe Delhi Chief Minister has been accused of using a government vehicle for personal purposes in the FIR filed by the returning officer.

Millions gather for first Amrit Snan at Maha Kumbh on Makar SankrantiThe amrit snan will witness the participation of 13 Akharas, or monastic orders of Hinduism, who will adhere to a meticulously planned schedule for the ritual bath.

How Ozempic, Zepbound, and Mounjaro will transform India's weight loss marketThe proportion of obese Indians has risen from 25 per cent in 2013 to 40 per cent in 2023, highlighting the need for effective weight-loss drugs.

How this Malibu mansion defeated wildfire. It's a concrete miracleAmid the devastation in Malibu from the California wildfires, a USD 9-million mansion stands unscathed and defiant. Its owner, a retired waste-management executive, called it a "miracle". However, the three-storey house's survival is more of science than miracle.

Watch: Kapil Dev responds to Yograj Singh's shocking 'pistol' claimFormer India captain Kapil Dev has reacted to Yograj Singh's claims that he went to the former skipper's house to kill him. Yograj had said that he wanted to shoot Kapil after being dropped from the North Zone team.

Rahul Gandhi compares Arvind Kejriwal to PM over 'fake promises', he hits backA war of words broke out between Rahul Gandhi and Arvind Kejriwal after the Congress leader accused the AAP chief of making false promises. Kejriwal said Gandhi "abused him".

Hrithik shares notes from rough book while prepping for Kaho Naa Pyaar HaiHrithik Roshan celebrated 25 years of Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai by sharing his debut prep notes. Reflecting on his nerves and process, he shared how little has changed in his approach over the years.

Champion last year, Rohan Bopanna suffers shock first-round exitAustralian Open 2025: The Indo-Colombian pair of Rohan Bopanna and Nicolas Barrientos was knocked out in the opening round of men's doubles on Tuesday, January 14. Bopanna, who won the Australian Open last year with Matthew Ebden, hasn't had a great start to the new season with his new partner.

Watch: Trump spoofs viral chat with Barack Obama, roasts Kamala Harris, BidenIn the parody video, Barack Obama appears to admit Kamala Harris had little chance of winning against Donald Trump. "I knew you'd win," the former president tells the President-elect in the fake audio.

Kho Kho World Cup: 4 months after stumbling upon sport, Brazil is at big stageAfter stumbling on the sport of Kho Kho just four months ago, a rag-tag Brazil team has arrived at the maiden World Cup. India Today speaks to Brazil's captain Gabriel Barros Coronas and coach Laura Doering about the team's journey and their hopes for the tournament.

India@2025: Home and abroad, two challenges that'll test Modi        The prime minister must initiate bolder reforms to rev up the economy while devising ways to strike a deal with Trump-led America on tariffs and migration grouses against India

Actor Anshu sides with 'loveliest man' Trinadha Rao after body-shaming remarkAnshu Ambani defends Telugu director Trinadha Rao Nakkina, calling him 'the loveliest man' despite the backlash over his comments on her weight at Mazaka teaser launch event.

India got true independence on Ram Mandir's consecration day: Mohan BhagwatRSS chief Mohan Bhagwat called Ram Temple consecration a symbol of "true independence" for India, highlighting unity and pride during the ceremony.

Sankranthiki Vasthunam X review: Fans call Venkatesh's film perfect Sankranti treatTelugu actor Venkatesh Daggubati's Sankranthiki Vasthunam, directed by Anil Ravipudi, impresses viewers, earning praise as a perfect family entertainer for the Sankranti festival.

Los Angeles braces for strong winds amid raging fires, deaths likely to spikeAs of early Tuesday, four of the total six wildfires in Los Angeles have burned more than 160 square kilometres of land, an area larger than San Francisco. Of these, the largest Palisades Fire is just 14 per cent contained, while the second-largest Eaton fire is 33 per cent contained.
Red alert on Dalal Street: Should investors worry?Sensex, Nifty today: While the sharp decline may cause concern, historical data suggests that market corrections are not uncommon.

KTR under house arrest over party MLA's clash with Congress leader Telangana police placed Bharat Rashtra Samithi working president KT Rama Rao (KTR), and fellow party leader Harish Rao under house arrest. This development came after their party MLA Kaushik Reddy was taken into custody for his fight with a Congress leader.

India successfully tests new version of Nag Mark 2 anti-tank guided missileIndia achieved a major defence milestone with successful trials of the indigenously developed Nag Mk 2 missile, showcasing precision fire-and-forget technology and bolstering anti-tank warfare capabilities.

Israeli soldiers threaten to stop fighting if Gaza ceasefire deal not securedA growing number of Israeli soldiers are speaking out against the 15-month conflict and refusing to serve any more, saying they saw or did things that crossed ethical lines. While the movement is small, some 200 soldiers signed a letter saying they'd stop fighting if the government didn't secure a ceasefire.

Rohit Sharma to play Ranji Trophy? Captain wants to train with MumbaiIndia captain Rohit Sharma wants to train with the Mumbai Ranji team to improve his form in Test cricket. Rohit has had two woeful Test series where he has failed to play any impactful knocks.

China considering selling TikTok US to Elon Musk to avoid potential ban: ReportUnder one scenario, Musk's social media platform X would take control of TikTok US and run the business together, a report by Bloomberg News said, adding that the Chinese officials have yet to reach any firm consensus about how to proceed.

Ram Gopal Varma calls Ram Charan's Game Changer box office numbers 'fraud'Ram Gopal Varma criticised the reported box office figures of Ram Charan's film Game Changer, alleging fraud and questioning the credibility of the numbers shared by the producers. He expressed concern over the exaggerated claims potentially undermining the achievements of other successful South Indian films.

Game Changer box office Day 4: Ram Charan film stumbles on 1st MondayRam Charan's Game Changer saw a dip in box office earnings on its first Monday. The film has earned Rs 97 crore in four days. It will now face competition from the Sankranti releases.

James Anderson on course to restart his T20 career with new Lancashire dealLegendary England fast bowler James Anderson is on course to revive his T20 career with a new one year contract with Lancashire where he will play both county cricket and T20 blast.

Watch: Hardik Pandya trains hard for 'big season' ahead of England T20IsHardik Pandya shared a glimpse of his intense personal training session via social media as he gears up for India's T20I series against England, sparking excitement amongst fans about his return to the national team.

PSL 2025 draft full squads: Kane Williamson, Warner to make debut in 10th seasonThe draft for the upcoming tenth season of the Pakistan Super League (PSL) was successfully held on January 13 as all six teams built up their squads. Kane Williamson, David Miller and Daryl Mitchell are all set to make their debut in tenth season.

Australian Open 2025, Day 3 schedule: Fritz, Medvedev and Bopanna start campaignThe Day 3 of the Australian Open will feature several big stars in action as Taylor Fritz, Daniil Medvedev, India's Rohan Bopanna amongst others will be in action.

India Open 2025: PV Sindhu eyes fresh start, leads home campaignIndia badminton Star PV Sindhu is excited to return to the court for the first time since Paris Olympics 2024 as she prepares herself to participate in the Indian Open 2025.

Australian Open Day 2: Djokovic, Gauff and Alcaraz advance, Kyrgios exitsDay 2 of the Australian Open delivered thrilling victories, surprising upsets, and emotional moments, with standout performances from Novak Djokovic, Coco Gauff, and Naomi Osaka. Local favorite Nick Kyrgios hinted at a potential singles retirement after an early exit.

Do not see myself playing singles in the Australian Open again: KyrgiosNick Kyrgios hinted at retirement from Australian Open singles matches after a disappointing first-round loss to Jacob Fearnley, citing injury frustrations. Despite his singles exit, he will continue competing in doubles alongside partner Thanasi Kokkinakis.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli will know when to call time: Kapil DevKapil Dev calls for patience as speculation over Rohit Sharma's retirement mounts, urging pundits and fans to trust India's seasoned captain and Virat Kohli as they face the challenge of reclaiming their form ahead of crucial tournaments.

Past glory keeps my hunger going for more in the future: PV SindhuP.V. Sindhu remains steadfast in her pursuit of badminton glory, drawing inspiration from past triumphs and evolving her game to stay competitive while mentoring India's next generation of players. Her passion and resilience continue to fuel her journey.

Shreyas Iyer ready to bat anywhere in ICC Champions Trophy 2025Star India batter Shreyas Iyer said that he's ready to bat anywhere in the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. The mega event is all set to begin from February 19.

Who is Nishesh Basavareddy? Indian-origin teen makes stunning Grand Slam debutNishesh Basavareddy left the tennis world in awe with a gutsy performance against Novak Djokovic at the Australian Open. The 19-year-old American of Indian origin embraced his Grand Slam debut with poise, earning respect from his idol.

Plenty of time left in my career to win more titles: PV SindhuIndia Open 2025: PV Sindhu, speaking to news agency PTI, reiterated that she is as hungry as ever to win major titles. The two-time Olympic medalist returns to action at India Open after missing the season-opening Malaysia Open due to her wedding.

Don't think players take coach Gautam Gambhir seriously, claims Monty PanesarFormer England spinner Monty Panesar feels Indian players don't take their head coach Gautam Gambhir seriously due to his poor record in Australia and England.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
